text: hi I'm srider I joined AWS last year as
a senior software engineer I'm currently
transitioning into a software
development manager role so as a as a
manager I need to look after the team's
initiatives projects make sure that
they're on track
I also need to look up to the engineers
within the team and make sure that they
are doing work which is fulfilling the
first surprise that I got when I came
here
to AWS was the scale of these systems
compared to my previous jobs the volume
of requests that come through AWS
they're quite high and we have built
systems which can withstand that load so
obviously trying to understand that
I'm getting to learn a lot and I think
that is the most
exciting part of my role I would think a
candidate who has a very curious mind
who is open to
investigate and also open to a lot of
learning I think those type candidates
will Thrive a lot in terms of career
progress there are a lot of paths once
an engineer joins uh AWS or Amazon
they're free to take any any roles or
any paths so they can go to the
individual technical contributor role or
they can decide to choose the managerial
path I chose AWS because because of the
scale of the company
and the problem it is solving
and I wanted to be part of this so that
I can also learn how to solve these
Planet scale problems
